page.title: 03Farming in North St.Helens
page.content: In our D block we identified{17} farms. They {varied}in size from 70 acres to{280}acres with the{average} size at{170 acres.}All the farmers interviewed had worked all thier life on the farm.{Windle Farm}was typical of the farm we visted. {Windle Farm had a{hundred}and{twenty acres}of grass land and crops.The only animals they have are{beef cattle}and they are kept in{sheds}to be{fattend up}and sent to market to be sold for food. The farm is a{hundred and fifty {years} old and most of the{hundred and {twenty acres}are used for growing crops. They grow{sugar beet {potatoes and corn.}They have{four and {a half tonnes}of corn that they feed to the{cattle.}They employ 2{women}as well as men. They use one thousand five hundred bales of hay in a year.
